section.name: Getting Started With Turbine
section.p: Currently, the best way to get started with Turbine is to use the Maven Environment for Turbine Applications (M.E.T.A.).

section.name: Binary And Source Distributions
section.p: If you already know how to use Turbine and simply want the latest binaries or source, you can get them from the apache mirror system in the turbine subdirectory.

section.name: Getting The Development Source From Subversion
section.p: You can check out the latest source from the Turbine Subversion repository. Information on connecting to the ASF Subversion repositories can be found on the version control page. More specific details can be found on the Source Repository page, within Project Reports under Project Documentation, of each Turbine sub-project.

section.name: Building The Source
section.p: Be sure and read the README.txt file for instructions on how to build Turbine. Turbine uses Maven as its build system, and building is as simple as running 'maven' or 'maven jar:jar' at the top of the source directory.
